While @realDonaldTrump and his administration may be obsessed with taking away health care from millions of Americans, @HouseDemocrats will continue to do just the opposite: we will fight tooth & nail to ensure that Americans have access to affordable & comprehensive health care.

I am deeply disappointed in the 5th Circuit’s ruling to strike down the individual mandate and to force millions of Americans to continue to live in fear that the ACA could be struck down in its entirety. https://rush.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/rush-statement-on-fifth-circuit-s-individual-mandate-ruling …

Currently, #Medicare patients have to pay out-of-pocket for eyeglasses, dentures, and hearing aids, often making them unaffordable for seniors. 

In addition to lowering drug costs, #HR3 will provide comprehensive vision, dental, and hearing coverage for these necessities. https://twitter.com/FrankPallone/status/1205184090724548610 …

Republicans' big ideas for drug pricing?

...

Spoiler: they don’t have one. On the other hand @HouseDemocrats will save the government nearly $500 billion with #HR3 and provide Americans with lifesaving drugs they can ACTUALLY afford. 

It’s time #LowerDrugCosts NOW! https://twitter.com/GOPLeader/status/1205176351923359746 …

In just 4 years, the cost of insulin has DOUBLED. These skyrocketing costs have forced 1-in-4 diabetes patients to ration their insulin. This is unconscionable. 

What's the point of life-saving medicine if you can't afford to take it?! It's time to #LowerDrugCosts & pass #HR3! pic.twitter.com/dH1XL06Qxg

Fred Hampton could move masses through his charisma, strength of his conviction and ideas, and through his courage. 

He was a leader of men and women, but more than anything else, Fred Hampton was a man that everybody knew. https://wgntv.com/2019/12/03/considering-fred-hamptons-legacy-50-years-after-his-death-in-police-raid/ …

You can kill a revolutionary, but you can't kill a revolution. 
The U.S. was founded on a revolution, and that revolution continues to this day. 

Fred was right, and his blood still introduces fruit. Groups like #BlackLivesMatter exist b/c of the blood of Fred Hampton. pic.twitter.com/9TbJE8M5T4

Fred was committed, not to just black people, but to all people. He used to say, "you cannot kill racism with racism. You kill racism with racial solidarity."

That's why in 1968, we joined forces with other activists to create the first Rainbow Coalition.  https://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/music/ct-young-patriots-organization-hideout-jon-langford-ent-0209-20160208-column.html … pic.twitter.com/zjT9V0bHUK

Why did they kill Fred? Why was this 24-year-old young man such a threat, that multiple law enforcement agencies would conspire to murder him?

Because Fred Hampton was a young man who had remarkable, extraordinary gifts. Because of his courage, his charisma, his commitment. pic.twitter.com/Lm2IGUVxkb

On a cold December morning, at 4:30 a.m., the assassins would come into the west side community with machine guns. 

They didn't arrive in police trucks, but public utility trucks instead. And they had the singular purpose of killing Fred & anyone else who was in that apartment. pic.twitter.com/rwQEvlzMa2

Tragically, Fred's murder was not an accident. It was planned by the highest levels of law enforcement in our nation.

The FBI conspired with the CPD to assassinate Fred, marking one of the few instances of political assassination by law enforcement agencies of this country. pic.twitter.com/zuPHmmtiJP

50 years ago today, my friend & fellow founder of the Illinois Black Panther Party, Fred Hampton, was assassinated by the Chicago Police Department while sleeping in his West Side apartment.

However, you can kill a revolutionary, but you cannot kill a revolution. pic.twitter.com/RgLIcLWF4M

HAPPENING NOW: Today, I am hosting a Special Order on the legacy of Fred Hampton. 

Tune into @cspan to watch live. pic.twitter.com/oFdvo4iSjW
If you were unable to attend today's hearing, you can watch both of today's panels here: https://youtu.be/AftiSBEGP2w

This is completely outrageous and should make us all sick.

That is why I am proud that the @EnergyCommerce's Subcommittee on Health called a hearing today to consider two important pieces of legislation designed to protect consumers from potentially deadly cosmetic products. pic.twitter.com/FCfCkNqU9k

Johnson & Johnson would eventually recall their asbestos-ridden product & pay BILLIONS of dollars (so far) to victims, but tragically, the damage has already been done.

Due to their greed & neglect, thousands of women have developed ovarian cancer. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/10/18/business/johnson-johnson-baby-powder-recall.html …

Furthermore, we must remember that this did not happen in a vacuum, particularly when it comes to minority communities. 

In 2006, Johnson & Johnson targeted black churches & beauty salons to sell discounted goods they knew to be possibly carcinogenic. https://www.reuters.com/article/us-johnson-johnson-marketing-specialrepo/special-report-as-baby-powder-concerns-mounted-jj-focused-marketing-on-minority-overweight-women-idUSKCN1RL1JZ …

Yet again, Black women find themselves "most at-risk" due to corporate greed & lack of oversight.

#DidYouKnow only 25% of products marketed to Black women are considered to be low in potentially hazardous ingredients, compared to 40% of the items marketed to the general public? https://twitter.com/MonicaAmarelo/status/1202270503152558083 …
